bibl.title: Letter from Mazyck P. Ravenel to Albert E. Truby, June 29, 1938

div1.p: Ravenel thanks Truby for the photograph. An autograph note by Truby identifies Ravenel as one of his professors at the University of Pennsylvania.

div1.head: Letter from Mazyck P. Ravenel to Albert E. Truby, June 29, 1938
div1.opener:
THE AMERICAN PUBLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION
American Journal of Public Health and the Nation's Health
MAZŸCK P. RAVENEL, M.D.
Editor in Chief
UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI, COLUMBIA, MISSOURI
June 29, 1938
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
General A.E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, Calif.
My dear Truby:
div1.p:
When I got home I found the little package from you giving me
the list of the Detachment Hospital Corps which was under your command in
Cuba in 1900, and also the photograph. I am more than obliged to you for
this and value it.

I cannot tell you how much pleasure it gave me to meet you again.
I have always thought of you and your cousin as star students, and as I told
you, the fact that you were studying photography on the side, which was then
not as common as it is today, impressed me tremendously. I hope it will not
be so many years before we meet again.
With my very best regards and again thanking you, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Mazyck P. Ravenel, M.D. MPR: IC
My instructer in bacteriology under Prof A. C. Abott
in the (Abbott's Lab U of Pa 1894)
The American Journal of Public Health is the Official Publication of this Association
